result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary R Bretzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Concurrent with: Present Sentence and Count 2.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Case 14CM2171 was dismissed and read in. No Contact with Samantha M. or Nicole P. or their residences. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or without agent's permission. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Straight Time. Concurrent with Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 07/13/15 plea & sentencing.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Zachary R Bretzel in court, in custody, with Attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl and Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2.  Repeater enhancer is stricken on Count #2.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant's father makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:    IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

42 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)   **Concurrent to present sentence and Count #2** 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  24 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____No contact with: Samantha M. or Nicole P. or their residences
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or without agent's permission
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted on this case and Case #14CM2171)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

COIUNT #2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:

9 MONTHS JAIL     **Concurrent to Count #1**

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid out of cash bail posted on this case and Case #14CM2171)

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
Sentencing memorandum.
